text: John Woolfolk (1797 – January 22, 1859) was a nineteenth-century American politician from Virginia. ==Early life== Woolfolk was born on "Pear Grove" plantation in Orange County, Virginia in 1797. He graduated from the College of William and Mary in 1819, and later from the B. L. Laughton Law School.Pulliam 1901, p. 115 ==Career== The Virginia Capitol at Richmond VA where 19th century Conventions met As an adult, Woolfolk made his home in Orange County practicing law.Pulliam 1901, p. 115 Woolfolk served in the Virginia House of Delegates for several years, then the state Senate for two terms.Pulliam 1901, p. 115 In 1850, Woolfolk was elected to the Virginia Constitutional Convention of 1850. He was one of three delegates elected from the central Piedmont delegate district made up of his home district of Orange County, as well as Culpeper, Greene and Madison Counties.Pulliam 1901, p. 99 ==Death== John Woolfolk died in Orange County, Virginia on January 22, 1859.Pulliam 1901, p. 115 == References == ==Bibliography== * Category:Members of the Virginia House of Delegates Category:1797 births Category:1859 deaths Category:People from Orange County, Virginia Category:College of William & Mary alumni
